1.title: I Know What You Didn't Do Last Summer
1.plot: Laura updates her viewers after spending two months in the Silas library.

2.title: Bad Blood
2.plot: Laura, Carmilla and LaFontaine have to deal with the fact that all water in the library turns into blood.

3.title: Checkpoint
3.plot: The Dean offers the gang a truce if they stop prying into her affairs.

4.title: Relative Positions
4.plot: The library takes the gang to a room filled with knives, where they may find the book they are looking for.

5.title: Raiders of the Lost Heart
5.plot: LaFontaine goes after Carmilla into the room with knives while Laura tries to deal with her feelings and emotions.

6.title: Best Laid Plans
6.plot: The Dean kills Laura's favorite professor in retaliation for meddling with her affairs and the gang try to understand the Book.

7.title: By the Book
7.plot: LaFontaine is investigating the Dean and the talismans while Laura and Carmilla try to deal with their feelings for each other.

8.title: All the Rage
8.plot: Danny and Theo come to the Library and demand the Book of Lives to be handed to them.

9.title: Meet the Parent
9.plot: Laura's father arrives at the library and the two of them have a heart-to-heart talk.

10.title: Crossroads
10.plot: Laura's father wants to take her home and she is wondering whether she should go with him or stay and try to save the university.

11.title: What Fresh Intel Is This?
11.plot: The gang are able to eavesdrop on the Dean thanks to JP and Laura is still not sure whether she should stay or go home.

12.title: Memory Lane
12.plot: Carmilla has a talk with Laura's father and then with Laura herself.

13.title: Warning Signs
13.plot: The gang discuss ways of getting the Sword of Hastur back from the Anglerfish pit.

14.title: Order of Magnitude
14.plot: The gang have to deal with the fact that the Dean is in fact a god.

15.title: Risk Assessments
15.plot: The gang experiment on the Sword of Hastur in hope they will find some clues about the third talisman.

16.title: Regrets, I've Had a Few
16.plot: Laura and Carmilla discuss the fact that the third talisman is in fact Mattie's locket. Meanwhile JP contacts them with news on the Dean's progress with opening Hell Gates.

17.title: Demon Summoning Made Simple
17.plot: The gang try to summon the goddess of death in hope she will help them defeat the Dean.

18.title: The Heart of the Matter
18.plot: The goddess of death uses Mattie as an avatar to propose Laura and Carmilla a wager.

19.title: Coping Strategies
19.plot: Laura has to deal with the fact that she might have crushed any hope of stopping the Dean when she killed Vordenberg. Laura and her father have a heartfelt conversation.

20.title: Circular Logic
20.plot: The gang discuss the best way of defeating the Dean without the fourth talisman and JP has an idea of his own. Laura and Carmilla try to establish the status of their relationship.

21.title: The Exorcism of Lola Perry
21.plot: The gang plan to exorcise the Dean, if possible without killing Perry.

22.title: Fun and Mind Games
22.plot: The exorcism they planned doesn't work and the gang are stuck with the Dean trapped in a magic circle.

23.title: Family Feud
23.plot: The Dean tries to convince both Mattie and Carmilla to see things from her perspective.

24.title: Break on Through
24.plot: The Dean is set free by her minions and reveals her plans for Carmilla.

25.title: ... To the Other Side
25.plot: Laura is transported to an alternative version of the Silas Library.

26.title: Objects in the Rearview Mirror
26.plot: Laura tries to get in contact with Vordenberg in the alternative reality. Meanwhile, LaFontaine and Carmilla are working on getting Laura back.

27.title: If You're Lost, You Can Look
27.plot: In a reality where she died, Laura meets parallel versions of Carmilla and Mattie.

28.title: Time After Time
28.plot: Laura and alternative Carmilla have a talk while Mattie is getting baron Vordenberg's heart.

29.title: Back to the Total Lack of Future
29.plot: Back in her own reality, Laura has to deal with failing to get Vordenberg's heart again.

30.title: Narrowing Paths
30.plot: Laura and Carmilla come up with a new plan for stopping the Dean. LaFontaine is strongly against it, as it would kill Perry too.

31.title: Long Goodbyes
31.plot: Mattie reveals that killing the Dean would also kill Carmilla. Danny brings Kirsch to the Library.

32.title: Places to Go, People to See
32.plot: Getting ready to go into the Pit and fight the Dean and knowing they may not return, Laura and Carmilla say their goodbyes.

33.title: A God Walks Into a Giant Pit...
33.plot: The gang go into the Pit to face the Dean.

34.title: They Blinded Me with Science
34.plot: Laura's plan to stop the Dean is interrupted by LaFontaine, who wants to save Perry. The Dean reveals that the fourth talisman is a heart, but not the one that belonged to Vondenberg.

35.title: Hell Hath No Fury
35.plot: When her plan doesn't work as intended, the Dean wants to destroy the world. Laura is dying when she realizes that the Dean is simply broken-hearted after losing her one true love.

36.title: Post Apocalypse
36.plot: Carmilla is made mortal again and decides to do anything she can to bring Laura back to life.

1.title: Disorientation
1.plot: Laura Hollis is three weeks into her first semester at Silas Uni, her roommate, Betty, mysteriously disappears after a party. A cryptic (and oddly moist) note leads Laura to believe that this isn't just a case of one too many Jäegerbombs.

2.title: Missing
2.plot: Laura's roommate at Sillas University has gone missing, the only clue being a cryptic, and fungus-infected, note. Determined to find Betty, Laura summons her inner Veronica Mars and starts her own investigation.

3.title: The Roommate
3.plot: Laura deals with her new "roommate", Carmilla, and documents the "Incursion of Room 307."

4.title: Freak OUT
4.plot: Laura meets her "official" and "unofficial" Floor-Dons, Perry and LaFontaine, when she tries to deal Carmilla's reign of terror. And deal, ya know, with #BloodMilkGate2014.

5.title: Patterns
5.plot: Laura broadens her investigation into the disappearance of her roommate Betty and questions to other co-eds that disappeared...and came back. It's weird.

6.title: Why Bother?
6.plot: Laura seems to be on to something when she uploads her videos to the Silas University network and finds out the hard way that some things are better left unsaid.

7.title: Town Hall
7.plot: Laura experiences the aftermath of the dreaded Town Hall meeting and enlists a new ~friend to help her investigate the mysterious disappearances around Silas University.

8.title: Pitsa i Thanato
8.plot: Laura gets stuck between and rock and a hard place when the "Bros" of Zeta Omega Mu barge in to protect the "hotties" and Carmilla shows her disdain in a rather aggressive way.

9.title: Nancy Drew
9.plot: Laura teams up with her TA Danny to continue her investigation into the disappearing girls and notices something very strange about someone we have met before.

10.title: The Real Betty
10.plot: Laura teams up with ~her TA~ Danny to continue her investigation into the disappearing girls and notices something very strange about someone we have met before.

11.title: A Visit from the Dean
11.plot: Laura starts to understand Carmilla, albeit briefly, before Danny arrives to continue the investigation.

12.title: Evidence
12.plot: Laura brings us up to date with her investigation and receives some uninvited guests before delving deeper into her suspicions surrounding Carmilla.

13.title: I, Spy
13.plot: Laura and Carmilla are telling the harrowing story of the fungus fiasco when Perry and LaFontaine pop by with some new information which Perry isn't processing too well.

14.title: Research Trip
14.plot: Laura and LaFontaine get the "bright idea" to head to the Library to do some research.

15.title: My Roommate, the Vampire
15.plot: Laura is upset about being the last to figure out that Carmilla is a vampire and LaFontaine lays out a less-than-ideal plan to the group.

16.title: Best Laid Plans
16.plot: Laura and her crew discuss the merits of the "vampire-bait" plan when some guests show up and give Laura a "brilliant" idea.

17.title: It's a Trap
17.plot: Laura takes on her new role as "Vampire Bait". Will the plan work out or is she about to get bitten?

18.title: While You Weren't Watching
18.plot: Natalie and SJ have gone missing - again. The gang try to figure out the best way to question Carmilla about their disappearances.

19.title: Advanced Interrogation Techniques
19.plot: Laura, Danny, LaFontaine and Perry accuse Carmilla of being a vampire. They resort to extreme measures to extract information from Carmilla, but her intentions are not what Laura had been expecting.

20.title: Sock Puppets and European History
20.plot: Carmilla tells Laura her side of the story, and Laura learns there's more to Carmilla and the missing girls than she first thought.

21.title: Strategic Planning
21.plot: The gang debate what to do about Carmilla. Laura is confronted by a co-ed.

22.title: Afterbite
22.plot: Laura tries to convince Carmilla to stay on campus, and a fight ensues. Laura worries about her lit mid-term which she has been neglecting in all the chaos.

23.title: We Need to Talk About Carmilla
23.plot: Carmilla asks Laura about the bracelet she gave her. Laura stands up to LaFontaine as Perry finds Danny for back-up.

24.title: Breaking Up (With an Amazon) Is Hard to Do
24.plot: Danny threatens Carmilla. Danny and Laura fight about Danny's overprotective nature. A strange event occurs on the Silas campus.

25.title: Basic Parasitology
25.plot: Laura talks about the recent events on campus. LaFontaine and Perry reveal the test results from the fluid found in Sarah-Jane and Natalie's room.

26.title: The Standard Issue
26.plot: Perry has had enough of the craziness at Silas. Laura has been having bad dreams. Laura and LaFontaine decide it's time to re-visit the library.

27.title: Required Reading
27.plot: Laura and LaFontaine return from the library with an old book and a new friend. Carmilla helps translate the contents of the book. Perry comes looking for LaFontaine.

28.title: Blame Enough for All
28.plot: Perry blames herself for what happened to LaFontaine. Carmilla reassures Laura. Laura talks to Kersch about recent events.

29.title: PTSD & Brownies
29.plot: Laura is surprised by Perry in the wee hours of the morning with a plate of brownies and seemingly nothing to do.

30.title: Monsters, Lies & Videotapes
30.plot: Laura, Carmilla, Perry and the newly-returned LaFontaine try to piece together what happened to LaFontaine since she has been gone when an unexpected audio recording sheds some light on the situation.

31.title: Of Hearts and Holy Hand Grenades
31.plot: Laura tries to get her life together as Carmilla and J.P. hit the books to look for a weapon powerful enough to take on the evil that lurks at Silas.

32.title: Mommy Dearest
32.plot: Laura hasn't really been herself lately since, ya know, being possessed by the Dean and Carmilla is the only one equipped to deal with it.

33.title: Pep Rally
33.plot: Laura decides it's a good idea to appeal to the student body at a school event and quickly learns a thing or two about the student body...and Carmilla.

34.title: Do Not Go Into The Light
34.plot: Laura is having a crisis of conscience as she thinks on the consequences of her actions when LaF inadvertently sparks an important insight into the mystery.

35.title: Heroic Vampire Bull****
35.plot: Laura and the gang decompress from the traumatic events that just unfolded and we learn much and more about the heroics of the people that surround and love Laura.

36.title: Life Goes On
36.plot: Laura turns the camera on one last time to share how she feels about the events that just unfolded at Silas...and talk about what she's lost.

37.title: The Christmas Special
37.plot: On the run from the strange goings-on at Silas, Laura and the gang find themselves holed up in a slightly suspicious diner with an owner who might be just too good to be true.

1.title: Brave New World
1.plot: Having just returned to Silas, Carmilla, Laura, LaF and Perry settle in the swish new digs Carmilla has just stolen for them. Things don't stay quiet for long.

2.title: The Voice of Silas
2.plot: Looking like an extra from Carrie, Perry tells our gang about the horror she encountered at the Voice of Silas. The terrible news prompts Laura to propose a plan of action and make amends for fleeing the campus.

3.title: SSN
3.plot: Laura gives Katie Couric a run for her money by taking over the Voice of Silas and turning it into the "Silas News Network". It's not long before she organizes a Peace Summit with the Zetas and the Summers.

4.title: War & Pieces
4.plot: With the Zetas and Summers unable to agree on a truce, Danny and Kirsch volunteer to become the "impartial" representatives of both factions while the gang attempts to find out who's behind the murders of the Voice of Silas staff.

5.title: Something Wicked
5.plot: Perry shows the unfortunate threat-written in Latin and in blood-inscribed onto her stomach. It ain't pretty. In true Silas fashion, Laura receives a creepy letter from the university announcing the return of the Board of Governors.

6.title: The Chair of the Board
6.plot: Matska "Mattie" Belmonde, the Chair of the Board-and Carmilla's big sister-threatens Laura and demands she alter her broadcasts.

7.title: Arrangements for Living
7.plot: Laura confronts Carmilla about the fact that they'd been living in The Dean's quarters; Mattie returns to "alter the message" of Laura's SNN broadcasts.

8.title: Vanishing Act
8.plot: The gang must deal with the disappearance of the Library - and that they may loose JP as a consequence.

9.title: Cutting Losses
9.plot: Mattie lays down the law and explains why The Board has been selling off the Campus to external parties. Just when the squad seems out of the options...they look at Carmilla: she's got to spy on her sister.

10.title: Sister Spycraft
10.plot: Carmilla makes like Sydney Bristow and invites Mattie for a blood cocktail & a chat, in an attempt to gleam information from her big sis.

11.title: Adonis Interrupted
11.plot: A frantic Kirsch hides in Laura & Carmilla's den; the Summer Society is after him since he's a stag in the Adonis Hunt!

12.title: Enter the Lugenbaron
12.plot: Laura and Carmilla meet another board member who might side with them against Mattie: Baron Vordenberg.

13.title: Emergency Procedures
13.plot: Perry is none too pleased when it turns out LaF has Frankensteined JP into Will's dead body. Meanwhile, Vordenberg reveals some information to Laura about Carmilla's past.

14.title: Sous Les Paves
14.plot: After an uninspiring "Silas for Students!" rally, Laura pushes Carmilla to become the Student Representative on the Silas Board. Carm has a choice to make.

15.title: No Heroics
15.plot: Laura and Carmilla grapple with the different - and perhaps unsurmountable - expectations they have of each other.

16.title: Old Habits
16.plot: Laura treats us to a montage of her gross vampire ex-girlfriend. Turns out the love goggles do hide the hair in the shower drain.

17.title: The Great Debate Prep
17.plot: When JP informs everyone that the Board intends to sell 15% of the Silas Students' Bodies, the gang comes up with a plan for Vordenberg to battle Mattie in a verbal debate to unseat her from the Board Chair position.

18.title: Coup De Grace
18.plot: Armed with the information to take down Mattie, Laura & Co - to Carmilla's alarm - aim to place Vordenberg as Board Chair, disregarding the consequences.

19.title: Dividing Lines
19.plot: Vordie's Anti-Vampire agenda now out in the open, Carmilla is now persona non grata on campus and flees.

20.title: Damage Control
20.plot: Mattie brings a wounded Carmilla back to Laura, but they struggle to find a middle ground.

21.title: Prisoner's Dilemma
21.plot: The gang hides the vampires under the floorboards, and narrowly avoids being caught by Vordie's patrols.

22.title: Compulsory Violence
22.plot: Perry attacks Mattie, Laura breaks down, and Carmilla gives up information that could change everything.

23.title: Wild Kingdom
23.plot: Carmilla, Mattie, JP, Laura and Danny adjust to their new normal under Vordie's rule - until LaF bursts in with some disquieting news.

24.title: Hunger Games
24.plot: Theo takes Kirsch to task about where his loyalties lie - with the Zetas or with Danny? The gang learns the hard way that you do not starve a vampire.

25.title: Bluster and Consequences
25.plot: Between Vordenberg's plan for Lophii and Mattie's plan for Silas, things are dire on campus.

26.title: Concerned Parties
26.plot: As Radio Free Vordenberg continues to spew anti-inhuman rhetoric around campus, Mattie takes Laura to task: she's a naïve girl who's in over her head and whose ill advised actions will only make things worse.

27.title: Zones of Friendship
27.plot: Kirsch and Danny have a heart to heart about where they stand - and he reveals what Vordie and the Zetas' plan is. Laura and Carmilla share a moment alone, and have their own realizations.

28.title: Spilled Blood
28.plot: Laura and Carmilla find Mattie in their room, knocked out and covered in blood. She doesn't remember what happened. So they turn to the camera.

29.title: Godslayer
29.plot: Believing she killed her sisters, Danny betrays Mattie and brings Vordenberg to the homebase. A tense stand-off ensues leading to a horrific conclusion.

30.title: Co-Existence
30.plot: Carmilla, full of rage, disappointment and fury at Laura - who killed Mattie by proxy - gives up on her and leaves.

31.title: Siege Tactics
31.plot: Reeling from Mattie's death, Carmilla's departure, and the Baron's goons closing in on them, the gang barricades their quarters and hope for the best.

32.title: Radio Letter
32.plot: Laura sees Carmilla out on the lawn and is afraid she's headed for the Anglerfish crater. As the siege continues, Laura broadcasts to Carm in hopes of bringing her back.

33.title: Just in Case
33.plot: Theo returns with an interesting proposition to double cross the Baron. Can they trust him?

34.title: Last Call
34.plot: As the siege gets worse and the Baron gets closer, Laura tries again to break through to Carmilla - who finally contacts her back. It's far from what Laura wants to hear.

35.title: Not Afraid
35.plot: In the penultimate episode of the season, true alliances are revealed and one of the Scoobie Gang is killed.

36.title: The Execution of Carmilla Karnstein
36.plot: Laura faces a choice she's never had to make: betray herself and what she stands for, or save Carmilla from Vordenberg.

37.title: Season Zero: Blast from the Past
37.plot: Laura and Carmilla get trapped in the Library, where they find a collection of VHS tapes. The tapes turn out to contain clips from the time when Mel Callis and Perry disappeared.

38.title: Zero - 0.2 - A Bro's Tale
38.plot: Carmilla agrees to Perry's plan to investigate what is happening on the campus, so she interviews Kirsch.

39.title: Zero - 0.3 - Lucy & Ethel
39.plot: Perry and Mel try to establish what is happening on the campus and why girls stop having their periods, while Carmilla threatens them with violence.

40.title: No One Expects
40.plot: Perry tries to use magic in order to reveal supernatural beings and find out what exactly happened at the swim team party.

41.title: The Missing... Link
41.plot: Perry is convinced that the strange happenings on the campus are magic-related, but Mel has a hard time believing in the existence of the supernatural.

42.title: Suspicious Minds
42.plot: Carmilla, Mel and Perry discus whether the Zetas may be responsible for girls not having their periods.

43.title: Lock-in
43.plot: The girls get locked in the room and Kirsch grows horns.

44.title: Blood, Where Art Thou?
44.plot: Mel reveals why she went to the swim team party and Carmilla blames Perry for the strange happenings again.

45.title: The Trouble with Tinkerbell
45.plot: The girls recap what they know in order to find out who is behind the missing periods.

46.title: Wishin' & Hopin'
46.plot: The girls research the Fairy Queen they think may be responsible for what is happening on the campus.

47.title: Clap If You Believe In...
47.plot: The Fairy Queen tempts the girls with fulfilling their heart's desires in order to dissuade Perry form trapping her again.

48.title: Nothing to See Here
48.plot: The Fairy Queen tempts the girls with fulfilling their heart's desires in order to dissuade Perry form trapping her again.

imdb.plot outline: Small town girl Laura Hollis has just finally moved out to go to Silas University. When her missing roommate is replaced without explanation, Laura vows to find out what is happening on campus while she deals with her new roomy... a vampire.
imdb.title: Carmilla
plot: Small town girl Laura Hollis has just finally moved out to go to Silas University. When her missing roommate is replaced without explanation, Laura vows to find out what is happening on campus while she deals with her new roomy... a vampire.::tyler-hodges

A modern take on Sheridan Le Fanu's gothic novella, _Carmilla_ (qv) follows Silas University freshman Laura Hollis, as she investigates her the disappearance of her roommate while dealing with her odd, nocturnal and sarcastic new roomie _Carmilla_ (qv) - who may or may not be a centuries-old vampiress. Mixing the camp of Buffy, the snark of Veronica Mars and the eerie quality of Welcome to Nightvale, _Carmilla_ (qv) is a transmedia narrative that expands to fictional twitter and tumblr accounts to Wattpad storytelling.
